{"step_by_step_thinking": "Fluoroscopy is a type of medical imaging that shows a continuous X-ray image on a monitor, much like an X-ray movie. It is often used to help the surgeon see and guide the procedure. However, it is not always essential for the retrieval of lower ureteric stones. The necessity of fluoroscopy can depend on the size, location, and composition of the stone, as well as the specific surgical technique being used. Therefore, while it can be very helpful, it is not always essential.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
